name: Shiverian Racer
description: TheShiverian Racer, referred to as theSupersonic Snowmanby theShiverian Elder, is ashiverianinSuper Mario Odyssey, making his home in Shiveria City in theSnow Kingdom. While other Shiverian Racers exist, this specific Shiverian Racer is found sobbing, saying that his opponents take the race too seriously, and that he is not going to compete and that someone else can take his place.

name: Uncle amiibo
description: Uncle amiibois a robotic character found inSuper Mario Odyssey. After talking to Uncle amiibo, tapping any amiibo or amiibo card will reveal the location of aPower Moonon the map. In 2-player mode, Uncle amiibo will refuse to let you scan an amiibo, simply stating, “them’s the rules.”

name: Sphynx
description: These statues will move once the player answers their riddles, which are often related to the kingdoms in which they are present. After the secret pathway has been opened, the Sphynx will ask additional questions. By answering all of the Sphynx's questions correctly, an achievement will be unlocked fromToadetteinMushroom Kingdom, which grants Mario a Power Moon.

description: Pauline(ポリーン,Porīn?)is a character who first appears in theDonkey Kongarcadegame. Here, she was once a damsel-in-distress whomMariohad to rescue fromDonkey Kong. Pauline has not often reappeared in theMariofranchiseand related media, mainly becausePrincess Peachhas taken the main role of damsel-in-distress since her first appearance inSuper Mario Bros..

name: Mollusque-Lanceur
description: Brigadier Mollosque-Lanceur III(ホーダン伯爵,Hōdan Hakushaku?, , lit. Drainage Cannonball), Dauphin of Bubblaine (alternatively spelledMollusque-Lanceur; French for "Mollusk Launcher") is a giant, well-dressed, purple octopus who appears as a boss inSuper Mario Odyssey. He initially appears atop the large glass chalice in theBubblaine, sucking the water from it with a bendy straw, as aBubblainianexplains whenMariomakes his way to the kingdom. As a result of his actions, fewer tourists are coming to...

name: Bubblainian
description: They wear red French-style berets, which, combined with their species, seems to be a reference to French dishes such as escargot which use snails as a main ingredient. This, combined with the name of the local boss,Mollusque-Lanceur, give Bubblaine a subtle French theme. The males have moustaches, brown shell necklaces, brown bodies, and white shells, and the females have eyelashes, pearl necklaces, pink bodies, and light tan shells.

name: Captain Toad
description: Captain Toad has a red spotted cap. In his debut appearance inSuper Mario Galaxy, he wears a generic red Toad outfit, with a red vest with gold piping, white pants, and small brown shoes. He wears a headlamp on his cap and a large brown backpack with a bed roll strapped on top.

attributes.Weaknesses: Cannot jump due to his heavy backpack

name: Glydon
description: Glydon is a yellow bipedal flying lizard. He's taller than Mario and features a long tail, two hands with three fingers and a thumb each and two rather short legs which are typically kept significantly bent and almost perpendicular to his tail, resulting in a very peculiar walking gait.

name: Jaxi
description: Jaxismake a fast way to travel in theSand Kingdomin the gameSuper Mario Odyssey. They can be found atJaxi Stands. They cost 30 coins to be used byMario.

They are chef aptly-like people who live in theVolbono areaof the Luncheon Kingdom. As you can probably gather, they're all really into their cooking.

name: Music Toad
description: Jammin' ToadMusic Toad fromSuper Mario Odyssey.Chronological informationFirst gameSuper Mario Run(2015)Game appearancesSuper Mario RunSuper Mario OdysseyPersonal informationGenderGenderlessHomelandMushroom KingdomRaceToadMusic Toad, (also calledJammin' Toad, and simplyToad) is a Toad wearing headphones, introduced in version 3.0.4 of Super Mario Run. He is found in the Kingdom Builder, and, if tapped on, can play music from the player's music library on his or her mobile device.

attributes.Games: Super Mario Run Super Mario Odyssey

name: Goombette (Super Mario Odyssey)
description: She also holdsPower Moons; to get them,Mariomustcapturea Goomba and approach her. If she is standing on a raised ledge, Mario must hop on other Goombas to make aGoomba Towerhigh enough to reach the ledge she stands on. At this point, she becomes romantically charmed, and gives Mario a Power Moon while surrounded by hearts. If Mario approaches her in his normal form, she will panic for a split second before disappearing in a puff of smoke.

name: Steam Gardener
description: Steam Gardeners need power to continue their work. This is shown as several steam gardeners are lined up at a charging station. One is already at the station, recharging his power, while the one at the back of the line (who waited too long) has passed out since he ran out of energy. One of the silver steam gardeners look silver and contain some seeds. One can be used to get to the obsevation deck, another for a climbable zone to reach somewhere higher, and the last one is in theDeep Woodsused...

name: Toad (species)
description: Toads are named after their mushroom (orToadstool) like appearance. Because of this, they are believed to be fungi. However they are not biologically related to mushrooms, seemingly have more of a relation to humans and they're essentially mushroom themed. Toads abilities are generally characterized by high speed, allowing them to run faster than most other characters, including regular human figures within theMario series.

name: Bonneter biologist
description: The Bonneter biologist is a scientist. He is eager to expand his knowledge, but is apparently shy, as shown by his habit of not moving from his spot and telling others to bring specimens to him for his research.

name: Talkatoo
description: In Japanese, Korean, and Chinese, the Talkatoo is called the "Hint Bird," with the word "hint" in his name untranslated in Japanese (Hinto Tori; ヒント鳥) and Korean (Hinteu Sae; 힌트새), although it is translated in Chinese (Tíshì Nǐao; 提示鳥). In Spanish, he is called "Cotorrete," from La Cotorra (parrot). In French, he is called "Perrotruc," derived from "perroquet" (parrot) and "Truc," a slang term for an unidentified object. The Talkatoo is referred to as Chiacchierotto in Italian, from chiacchie...

name: Hint Toad
description: TheHint Toadis a Blue-coloured Toad character who first apeared inSuper Mario Galaxywere he is part of theToad Brigade.Unlike his other other members, Hint Toad is the only Toad that wears goggles, which depicts him being the smartest Toad of the group.

attributes.Games: Super Mario Galaxy Super Mario Galaxy 2 Captain Toad: Treasure Tracker Super Mario Odyssey Super Mario 3D World + Bowser's Fury

name: Roving Racers
description: TheRoving Racersare a quartet ofKoopa TroopasinSuper Mario Odyssey. After defeatingBowserin theMoon Kingdom, a green Koopa Troopa wearing a cap, along with a rankings board will appear in every kingdom, so the player can compete in a Koopa Freerunning mini-game (with the exception of theCloud Kingdom,Ruined Kingdom,Dark SideandDarker Side). The player must win the race by managing to reach the shining beacon at the end to receive aPower Moonbefore the Roving Racers do. They are based onKoopa ...

name: Hariet
description: Hariet(ハリエット,Harietto?, ,lit. Hariet)is one of theBroodalsthat can be fought inSuper Mario Odyssey. Her name comes from "hare" and is sometimes given the nameHarriet. In the main story, she is fought in the missions "Inverted Pyramid Showdown" and “Big Broodal Battle” (along with the other Broodals.

name: New Donker
description: Most of the New Donkers, both male and female, wear gray business suits and have a1930s-1940s look. The male New Donkers also wear ties, gray fedoras, and shiny black shoes, while the female New Donkers wear gray sunhats. The only New Donkers who do not wear gray attire are the members ofPauline's band, who all wear red attire and black fedoras with a white band around it, and theCrazy Capemployees.

name: Poochy
description: Poochyis a recurring ally in theYoshifranchise. Poochy made his first appearance inSuper Mario World 2: Yoshi's Island, and while he is not the main protagonist of a game, Poochy is featured inPoochy & Yoshi's Woolly World's title, as well as having his own sub-game calledPoochy Dash. Poochy has sometimes appeared in the parentMariofranchise, albeit less prominently.

name: Tostarenan
description: Tostarenans are based on the typical candysugarskulls, candy coming from a Mexican tradition called "day of the dead" the candy has a skull shape, and Mexican stereotype(people with sarape, mustache, and sombrero). As from their appearance, they're in all Mexican clothing, holding maracas, which are an instrument in Mexico.
